title: Infra Setup: Initialize Terraform Project
description: Initialize a Terraform project within the `infrastructure/` directory. Configure the AWS provider, set up the S3 backend for remote state management with locking via DynamoDB, and create `dev`, `staging`, and `prod` workspaces.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: `terraform init` runs successfully and configures the S3 backend. The `dev`, `staging`, and `prod` workspaces are created and can be selected.
definition_of_done: Terraform project structure created; `backend.tf` and `provider.tf` committed; Workspaces verified.
testing_requirements: Successful execution of Terraform CLI commands.

title: FE Setup: Initialize React Project with Vite and TypeScript
description: Scaffold a new React project using Vite with the TypeScript template. Configure `tsconfig.json`, ESLint, and Prettier for a consistent and high-quality development environment.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: The development server can be started with `npm run dev`. Linting and formatting are configured and can be run via npm scripts.
definition_of_done: React project structure in `client/` directory is committed; `package.json` and config files are finalized.
testing_requirements: Successful execution of `npm run dev` and `npm run lint`.
deployment_notes: First step for all frontend development.
business_value: Creates the frontend codebase and development environment.

title: BE Setup: Initialize NestJS Backend Project
description: Scaffold a new NestJS project using the Nest CLI. Configure basic settings, including `tsconfig.json`, `.eslintrc.js`, and Prettier for code consistency.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: The NestJS application can be started locally via `npm run start:dev`. Linting and testing scripts run successfully.
definition_of_done: NestJS project structure in `server/` directory is committed; `package.json` and config files finalized.
deployment_notes: First step for all backend development.
business_value: Creates the backend codebase and development environment.

title: Terraform: Define AWS Cognito User Pool and App Client
description: Write and test Terraform configuration to provision the AWS Cognito User Pool, including password policy (REQ-1-071) and App Client for the SPA with OAuth 2.0 Auth Code + PKCE flow.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: Terraform apply creates User Pool and App Client. Password policy and PKCE flow are correctly configured.
definition_of_done: `cognito.tf` Terraform file is committed and successfully applied.
testing_requirements: Review of AWS Console resources and successful `terraform apply`.
business_value: Provisions the core identity management system for the application.

title: Analysis & Library Selection for Expression Evaluation
description: Evaluate third-party JavaScript math libraries (e.g., math.js) for parsing and evaluating mathematical expressions based on features, performance, and bundle size.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: A comparison matrix of at least two libraries is created. A final library is selected and the decision is documented.
definition_of_done: Decision document/ADR is created; library is added to `package.json`.
business_value: Ensures a robust and performant foundation for all calculator features.

title: Implement Expression Evaluation Service
description: Create a TypeScript service that wraps the selected math library to evaluate expression strings, handle order of operations, and manage errors like division by zero.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: The `evaluate` function correctly calculates expressions following PEMDAS. It throws specific errors for syntax issues and division by zero.
definition_of_done: `evaluationEngine.ts` module created; Unit tests achieve >90% coverage.
testing_requirements: Extensive unit tests for various expressions and error cases.
deployment_notes: Core logic for the entire calculator.
business_value: Provides the brain for all calculations performed in the application.

title: Integrate Core Calculator Components
description: Assemble the `CalculatorDisplay`, `Keypad`, and `HistoryPanel` components into a cohesive view. Ensure state changes are correctly reflected and the evaluation engine is triggered.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: The integrated calculator view is functional. User can type an expression, calculate it, and see the result and history update.
definition_of_done: `CalculatorPage.tsx` or similar container component is implemented and functional.
testing_requirements: Successful E2E testing of the full feature.
business_value: Assembles the individual components into a usable core calculator.

title: Backend: Implement CustomModes Controller (API Endpoints)
description: Implement the `CustomModesController` to expose CRUD logic via RESTful API endpoints, protected by the `JwtAuthGuard`.
sprint_goal: Enable full persistence of user data (History, Custom Modes) and build the UI for creating custom modes.
acceptance_criteria: All five CRUD endpoints are defined. `JwtAuthGuard` is applied. Request DTOs with `class-validator` are used.
definition_of_done: `custom-modes.controller.ts` and DTO files are implemented and tested.
testing_requirements: Passing integration tests for the controller.
deployment_notes: Exposes the core custom mode functionality to the client.
business_value: Provides the API for the frontend to manage user-created custom modes.

title: Frontend: Implement History Panel with Persistence
description: Enhance the `HistoryPanel` component to handle both anonymous (session-based) and registered (API-based) users. On login, it should fetch history via RTK Query. New calculations for logged-in users should trigger a `POST` request.
sprint_goal: Enable full persistence of user data (History, Custom Modes) and build the UI for creating custom modes.
acceptance_criteria: For anonymous users, history is session-based. For logged-in users, history is fetched from the API. New calculations are persisted for logged-in users.
definition_of_done: Updated `HistoryPanel.tsx` and RTK Query service definitions are implemented and tested.
testing_requirements: E2E testing of both anonymous and registered user flows.
deployment_notes: High risk due to complexity of switching between anonymous and authenticated states.
business_value: Delivers a key value proposition for user registration: persistent calculation history.

title: Frontend: Implement Multi-Step Wizard UI Framework
description: Develop a reusable React component for a multi-step wizard to manage the creation of custom modes, including state management and navigation between steps.
sprint_goal: Enable full persistence of user data (History, Custom Modes) and build the UI for creating custom modes.
acceptance_criteria: The wizard displays one step at a time. 'Next' and 'Back' buttons work. State is preserved when navigating.
definition_of_done: `Wizard.tsx` component and associated hooks are implemented and tested.
deployment_notes: A foundational component for the custom mode creation flow.
business_value: Provides the user interface framework for the app's flagship feature.

title: Lambda: Develop Secure Formula Execution Handler
description: Create the Node.js AWS Lambda function handler using `isolated-vm` to securely compile and execute user-provided formulas in an isolated V8 context.
sprint_goal: Deliver secure custom mode execution, offline data synchronization, and the Ohm's Law calculator.
acceptance_criteria: Handler accepts a formula and inputs. `isolated-vm` is used to run the script. Returns a result or structured error. Strict timeout and memory limits are enforced.
definition_of_done: Lambda function source code and unit tests are complete.
testing_requirements: Passing unit tests and successful invocation in AWS Lambda console.
deployment_notes: RISK-001: High risk of sandbox escape. Requires mandatory security review.
business_value: Implements the secure execution core of the application's most innovative feature.

title: Frontend: Implement Offline Queuing for History
description: Implement client-side logic to queue new calculation history items in IndexedDB when offline and sync them to the backend when connectivity is restored.
sprint_goal: Deliver secure custom mode execution, offline data synchronization, and the Ohm's Law calculator.
acceptance_criteria: When offline, new calculations are queued in IndexedDB. When online, queue is processed and sent to backend. Queue is cleared on successful sync.
definition_of_done: `offlineSyncService.ts` and updated Redux middleware are implemented and tested.
testing_requirements: E2E tests that simulate offline/online transitions using Cypress.
deployment_notes: RISK-002: High risk of data loss bugs due to complexity of offline logic.
business_value: Makes the application resilient to network issues, a key non-functional requirement.

title: Frontend: Develop Ohm's Law Calculator UI Component
description: Create the `OhmsLawCalculator.tsx` component with four input fields for Voltage, Current, Resistance, and Power.
sprint_goal: Deliver secure custom mode execution, offline data synchronization, and the Ohm's Law calculator.
acceptance_criteria: The UI displays four correctly labeled input fields. The layout is responsive and accessible.
definition_of_done: `OhmsLawCalculator.tsx` component file and component tests are complete.
testing_requirements: Visual inspection and passing component tests.
business_value: Provides the user interface for a key specialized calculation mode.
